meanings.definition: To cut off or trim the snags or branches of (a tree)
meanings.sent1: Dad will snigs the tree branches to make it look neat.
meanings.sent2: The gardener snigs the overgrown bushes every spring.
meanings.sent3: The tree begged Dad not to snigs its beautiful branches.
meanings.sent4: She carefully snigs away the dead branches, like trimming a delicate bonsai tree.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the saw cutting through the branches as he snigs was oddly satisfying.

meanings.sent1: The snigs swam gracefully in the clear water.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen caught some snigs for their aquarium.
meanings.sent3: The snigs challenged the bigger fish to a race.
meanings.sent4: The snigs moved through the water like a sleek submarine.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled with delight as they watched the snigs dart around in the pond.

meanings.definition: A small piece of wood, especially one used as kindling
meanings.sent1: She added some snigs to the fire to keep it burning.
meanings.sent2: The camper collected snigs to start the campfire.
meanings.sent3: The snigs in the fireplace crackled and popped merrily.
meanings.sent4: The snigs caught fire quickly, lighting up the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fire was comforting, fueled by the snigs she had gathered.
